Usain Bolt: s statement: The expert's verdict mentions that Jamaican sprinter Usain Bolt, who holds world records in the 100-meter and 200-meter dash, stated that he is not scared of Zika since he can always outrun virus-carrying mosquitoes. This statement is one aspect that was employed to verify the authenticity of the claim.
Bolt: s average speed: The expert's verdict provides information about Bolt's average speed in all past races listed by the International Association of Athletics Federations, which is 21.65 miles per hour. This aspect was used to compare Bolt's speed with the cruising speed of mosquitoes to determine if he could outpace them.
Mosquitoes: stamina: The expert's verdict states that researchers have documented Aedes aegypti mosquitoes flying continuously for two to nine hours, with an average of 2.2 hours. This aspect was considered to determine if Bolt or anyone else would have to run more than 7.37 miles in that time frame to outpace the mosquito.
